channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Large Pot-hole, 7th March
item.description:
Just as you leave the motorway at J11 M5 southbound, there is a large pothole which was until recently covered by the road work bollards running on the right-hand lane exit markers. Smaller vehicles may just about avoid it, but larger ones I suspect will not.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): M5, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous pothole, 7th March
item.description:
Dangerous pothole because this is in a very narrow part of the road. I watched aCyclist nearly get knocked off their bike the other day because they swerved to avoid the pothole (otherwise they come off their bike if they went into it) , and the car on other side of road didnâ€™t have enough room to respond to their diversionAnd had to brake urgently
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 119 Old Bath Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole, 7th March

item.title: Question New Road Markings White Lines Junction 11 of the M5, 7th March
item.description:
Hello, the newly re-opened Junction 11 of the M5 has just been re-surfaced and new white lines added to the roundabout. Coming from the south of the M5 coming off and turning right to Cheltenham the sign posts show a right turn to Cheltenham. However the white lines half way round the roundabout suddenly plunge the left lane back down on to the M5 - despite signage showing two lanes can turn right to Cheltenham round the roundabout. We have had a number of staff report this problem. It looks like the new white lines down the centre of the road at this point have been added incorrectly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A40, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain cover sinking into the pavement on Shakespeare, 6th March
item.description:
This drain cover has been sinking into the pavement and now has a 2 inch lift at the edge which is a trip hazard please could someone come and take a look at it?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 81 Shakespeare Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
